title: How to set the New Tab page to a local file? (autoconfig no longer works in v136.0)
content:
Since the settings haven't given that option for years, the best way to have a local file as the new tab page was using autoconfig.cfg + autoconfig.js, as described in this thread: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1251199 But since the most recent update (v136.0), this stopped working.

The New Tab Override add-on has its own issues with using local files (can only load a .html file, no local CSS/JS, can't give a blank address bar for me to search in), so it doesn't solve the issue either.

This is very important to me, and others have been asking for this feature back for years. It feels awful to have the working solution stop working, in the browser that's supposed to be open and customizable.
creator: lirangamer

title: Feedly and www.allizom.org domain name. Security issue ?

I found that very suspect and would like to understand why feedly use www.allizom.org ? Who are www.allizom.org ? Why they introduce themselves as mozilla.org ? Thanks & best regards

title: Consumo batteria
content:
Buongiorno! Firefox mi consuma la batteria a tempo di record (ieri il 49% in 34 minuti, e il pc è nuovissimo (Mircrosoft Surface, vanterebbe una durata fino a 16 ore di utilizzo); non succede minimamente con gli altri browser (ho installato Edge, Chrome, Opera, Vivaldi e DuckDuckGo per fare le prove); laddove Firefox mi "ciuccia" il 7%, gli altri sono a meno dell'1%. (la stessa cosa succedeva con ff al vecchio pc (Windows 10), pensavo fosse un problema appunto del pc).

Ho anche controllato tramite Gestione attività: la beffa. Consumo elettrico da un paio di picchi di "basso" a "molto basso" durante la navigazione. Dato che ff però è il mio preferito in assoluto, grazie alle varie soluzioni che offre, vorrei continuare ad usarlo come mio browser. Come posso risolvere? In alternativa, come posso estrapolare tutte le password per passarle in un altro browser? (pensavo a Vivaldi) Grazie per l'aiuto che mi vorrete fornire, cordiali saluti, Berit N. Johnsen
creator: vallucci

title: Discord not playing videos
content: The Discord website does not play embedded video files (mov, mp4, etc). This is an issue specific to Firefox, and is not present in other browsers such as Chrome. This issue is only for video files and not embeds from sites such as Youtube or Twitter/X. Furthermore, when downloading these videos, they play solely the audio and not the video part of it. This is not an issue with any other downloaded video. I have tried clearing my cache and restarting Firefox, as well as disabling my extensions. None of which has worked.

title: firefox updates reset my settings
content:
every time firefox does these automatic updates in the background, it resets certain security settings that cause me anger and frustration.

example: is that I access all my secure sites via Lastpass... and the latest update has killed that ability and I need now to go down into the bowels of the firefox settings to figure out how to get Last pass functionality working again...it is a huge time waster and frustrating when I need to use this immediately.

any advice for me before I give up firefox and revert to using a Chrome browser again?
